revised_title: The Influence of Suckling Stimulus on Prolonged Lactation and Oestrous Cycle
tldr: The study investigates the effects of the suckling stimulus on lactation and the oestrous cycle in rats. It shows that lactation can be prolonged indefinitely by providing a succession of young foster litters, leading to a steady state of milk production. The suckling stimulus also affects the oestrous cycle, causing a prolongation of the cycle length. The research also explores the possibility of restarting lactation after weaning and the impact of mating on lactation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
